WorkItem.Description:
Visual Studio 2012
Source Control: TFS
TypeScript 0.8.3.1
Web Essentials 2012

In my current project, I have an already saved TypeScript file with no compiled files added to the project (ie. helloWorld.ts). I make changes to helloWorld.ts. After I run the project, the compiled files helloWorld.js, helloWorld.js.map, and helloWorld.min.js are added to the .csproj file. I try to remove the compiled JavaScript files by deleting them from the project. I then save-all. The .csproj file does not include those JavaScript files anymore. If I make more changes to helloWorld.ts and run again, then the compiled JavaScript files are re-added to the project again.
WorkItem.Summary: visual studio - compiled JavaScript files keep being re-added to my project

Comments.Message:
Can you expand further on your issue here.  I'm not following 100% from the steps outlined.  Did you start with a project with the typescript & JavaScript, remove the JavaScript manually from the .csproj, and are seeing these files get readded in the .csproj file on compilation?

You also mention 'sometimes'.  Is this not consistent?  Roughly how frequently does this happen?  Are there any specifics steps that are performed when it does occur?

Are you using any type of source control system?  Or is this just a file based project loaded off disk?  Which version of TypeScript are you using?  The project integration is not identical across all versions we have released.

If you can provide more specifics on your actions and observations we'll take a look.  Thanks.

Visual Studio 2012
Source Control: TFS
TypeScript 0.8.3.1

In my current project, I have an already saved TypeScript file with no compiled files added to the project (ie. helloWorld.ts). I make changes to helloWorld.ts. After I run the project, the compiled files helloWorld.js, helloWorld.js.map, and helloWorld.min.js are added to the .csproj file. I try to remove the compiled JavaScript files by deleting them from the project. I then save-all. The .csproj file does not include those JavaScript files anymore. If I make more changes to helloWorld.ts and run again, then the compiled JavaScript files are re-added to the project again.

It sounds like you might have the Web Essentials extension installed, is that true? Or any other extensions?

** Closed by danquirk 06/27/2013 5:14PM
Yes I have Web Essentials 2012 installed.
